plugin.name: Darkest (level 0)
plugin.description: Make the nights in the Commonwealth almost pitch black.

plugin.name: Darker (level 1)
plugin.description: Make the nights in the Commonwealth much darker.

plugin.name: Dark (level 2)
plugin.description: Make the nights in the Commonwealth quite darker.

plugin.name: Medium (level 3)
plugin.description: Make the nights in the Commonwealth reasonably darker.

plugin.name: Light (level 4)
plugin.description: Make the nights in the Commonwealth somewhat darker.

plugin.name: Lighter (level 5)
plugin.description: Make the nights in the Commonwealth slightly darker.

plugin.name: Lightest (level 6)
plugin.description: Make the nights in the Commonwealth only a bit darker than the vanilla game.

plugin.name: Vanilla Sky
plugin.description: Keep the sky as bright as in the vanilla game. NOTE: Dark sky may cause unsightly flickering above the horizon in some locations during certain weather.

plugin.name: 24/7 Mode
plugin.description: Make day time as dark as the night, because why the hell not. (Pun not intended.)

plugin.name: Far Harbor DLC
plugin.description: Select this option if you own the Far Harbor DLC.

plugin.name: Nuka World DLC
plugin.description: Select this option if you own the Nuka World DLC.

plugin.name: None
plugin.description: Leave this option selected if you are not using any of the major weather overhauls below.

plugin.name: True Storms 1.4
plugin.description: Select this option if you are using True Storms 1.4 (compatible with 1.4.1). http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4472/

plugin.name: Vivid Weathers 1.11
plugin.description: Select this option if you are using Vivid Weathers 1.11 (compatible with 1.20 and 1.25). http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15466/

plugin.name: FogOut v6
plugin.description: Select this option if you are using FogOut v6. This patch is ONLY required if you are using the version which removes the distant fog from both interior and exterior. http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2428/

plugin.name: Nuclear Weathers 0.8
plugin.description: Select this option if you are using Nuclear Weathers 0.8. NOTE: Not intended for the True Storms compatible version. http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/9063/

plugin.name: Radiant Clouds and Fogs 1.3
plugin.description: Select this option if you are using Radiant Clouds and Fogs 1.3 but ONLY if you intend to enable its plugin, e.g. heavy fogs. If you installed the mod just for its textures this patch is not needed. http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/735/

plugin.name: Vanilla
plugin.description: NPC detection will not be adjusted. Sneaking will be the easier the darker option you choose and in some cases the NPC will be unable to discover you at all even when stood near you.

plugin.name: Automatic (Recommended)
plugin.description: NPC detection will be adjusted automatically according to the chosen level of darkness.

plugin.name: Hardest (level 0)
plugin.description: Make it ultimately easier for the NPCs to see you in low light conditions. Recommended for the "Darkest" level of darkness.

plugin.name: Harder (level 1)
plugin.description: Make it much easier for the NPCs to see you in low light conditions. Recommended for the "Darker" level of darkness.

plugin.name: Hard (level 2)
plugin.description: Make it quite easier for the NPCs to see you in low light conditions. Recommended for the "Dark" level of darkness.

plugin.name: Medium (level 3)
plugin.description: Make it reasonably easier for the NPCs to see you in low light conditions. Recommended for the "Medium" level of darkness.

plugin.name: Easy (level 4)
plugin.description: Make it somewhat easier for the NPCs to see you in low light conditions. Recommended for the "Light" level of darkness.

plugin.name: Easier (level 5)
plugin.description: Make it slightly easier for the NPCs to see you in low light conditions. Recommended for the "Lighter" level of darkness.

plugin.name: Easiest (level 6)
plugin.description: Make it only a bit easier for the NPCs to see you in low light conditions. Recommended for the "Lightest" level of darkness.

plugin.name: Vanilla
plugin.description: Select this option if you want to use vanilla Night Vision or if you are using another mod which changes the Night Vision, such as Alternative Vision at http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/8242/

plugin.name: Alternative (Green Tint)
plugin.description: Use an alternative Night Vision with a green tint for Night Vision scopes. Night Person perk (2nd rank) vision will cause a clean white illumination. You may configure the strength in a subsequent installation step.

plugin.name: Alternative (Blue Tint)
plugin.description: Use an alternative Night Vision with a blue tint for Night Vision scopes. Night Person perk (2nd rank) vision will cause a clean white illumination. You may configure the strength in a subsequent installation step.

plugin.name: Alternative (Red Tint)
plugin.description: Use an alternative Night Vision with a red tint for Night Vision scopes. Night Person perk (2nd rank) vision will cause a clean white illumination. You may configure the strength in a subsequent installation step.

plugin.name: Stronger
plugin.description: Make Night Vision stronger. Recommended for the "Darker" and "Darkest" levels of darkness. This choice affects both the Night Vision scopes and the Night Person perk (2nd rank) vision.

plugin.name: Moderate
plugin.description: Make Night Vision moderate. Recommended for the "Dark" and "Medium" levels of darkness. This choice affects both the Night Vision scopes and the Night Person perk (2nd rank) vision.

plugin.name: Weaker
plugin.description: Make Night Vision weaker. Recommended for the "Light", "Lighter" and "Lightest" levels of darkness. This choice affects both the Night Vision scopes and the Night Person perk (2nd rank) vision.
